page.title: 08CHARLTON ORCHARDS
page.content: Charlton Orchards are owned in partnership and they began the farm in 1960.They have 44 acres,of which 9 acres are buildings,hedges and conservation areas.They have roughly 50,000 trees.They grow apples,pears, plums,gooseberries and damsons. Their main crop is apples_26 acres of dessert apples and 4 acres of cooking apples.The majority of the crop is sent to Bristol Wholesale Market.They go in 20lb cartons and 30lb wooden boxes.Any rejects are sent to the local cider company.A small percentage of the fruit is sold directly to local shops and through their own farm shop. In late July and early August they sometimes have 'Pick Your Own'. This is for everything except apples. The two owners work full_time and local women are employed part_time, according to the season.
